docs.lead_paragraph: UnitedHealth Group, one of the largest health-insurance providers, said yesterday that its board would vote May 1 on whether to end stock-based compensation for a small number of top executives who already have a well-established stake. The board may eliminate golden-parachute packages tied to a change in control, freeze supplemental retirement benefits and drop non-cash perquisites for certain officers, the company said today in a statement.
docs.abstract: UnitedHealth Group board will vote on May 1 on whether to end stock-based compensation for small number of top executives who already have well-established stake (S)
docs.snippet: UnitedHealth Group, one of the largest health-insurance providers, said yesterday that its board would vote May 1 on whether to end stock-based compensation for a small number of top executives who already have a well-established stake.     The board...

docs.lead_paragraph: The Bush administration issued a new policy on Wednesday that protects Medicare beneficiaries against the sudden loss of coverage for drugs they are taking under the prescription drug program. Under the policy, insurers can still change their lists of covered drugs, known as formularies. But if they drop any drugs or impose new restrictions, they must exempt beneficiaries who are now taking those drugs.

headline.main: Medicare Rule Guarantees Continuity Of Drugs

docs.snippet: Under a new policy in the prescription drug program, insurers that drop coverage for a drug must exempt beneficiaries who already take it.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Bush, who touched a nerve this year when he told Detroit carmakers to build ''relevant'' vehicles, will meet with the companies' leaders next month, William Clay Ford Jr., the chief executive of Ford Motor, said Wednesday. People involved in planning the meeting, who spoke on condition of anonymity because of the high level of the talks, said it would focus on three areas: energy and the environment; costs like pensions and health care premiums that add hundreds of dollars to the price of a Detroit car; and how currency issues affect the Japanese automakers.

headline.main: Bush to Meet Big 3 for Talks On Fuel Issues And Pensions

docs.abstract: Pres Bush plans to meet with Ford Motor chief executive William Clay Ford, Rick Wagoner of General Motors and Thomas LaSorda of Chrysler at White House on May 18; talks will focus on energy and environment, costs like pensions and health care premiums that add to price of American cars and how currency issues affect Japanese automakers; Ford, in interview, says he wants to use meeting to lobby government to finance national delivery system for ethanol (M)
docs.snippet: The meeting is expected to focus on energy and the environment; costs and pricing; and how currency issues affect Japanese automakers.

docs.lead_paragraph: EHealth, an online seller of health insurance, Tuesday said it plans to go public in an initial stock offering worth as much as $85 million. The company, based in Mountain View, Calif., didn't disclose the number of shares to be offered or an estimated price range in its filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

docs.lead_paragraph: A group led by Network Healthcare Holdings of South Africa agreed to buy the General Healthcare Group for £2.2 billion ($3.9 billion) to become the leading private care provider in Britain. Network Healthcare, known as Netcare, will buy a 50.1 percent stake from BC Partners Ltd., manager of a European buyout fund. Apax Partners Worldwide, London and Regional Properties and funds advised by Brockton Capital will own the rest, Netcare said.

headline.main: World Business Briefing | Europe: Britain: General Healthcare to Be Sold

docs.abstract: Group led by Network Healthcare Holdings of South Africa agrees to buy 50.1 percent stake in Britain's General Healthcare Group from BC Partners Ltd for 2.2 billion pounds ($3.9 billion) (S)
docs.snippet: A group led by Network Healthcare Holdings of South Africa agreed to buy the General Healthcare Group for £2.2 billion ($3.9 billion) to become the leading private care provider in Britain. Network Healthcare, known as Netcare, will buy a 50.1...

docs.lead_paragraph: The California Public Employees Retirement System, the largest public pension fund, said yesterday that the UnitedHealth Group, the health insurance company, must explain the $2.4 billion in stock options granted to its top executives. Calpers, as the pension fund is known, sent a letter to UnitedHealth, asking for a meeting before UnitedHealth's shareholder vote on May 2. Calpers may withhold its proxy votes for the chief executive, William W. McGuire, who will receive $1.6 billion in options, and the members of the compensation committee, a Calpers spokesman, Clark McKinley, said.
docs.abstract: California Public Employees Retirement System sends letter to UnitedHealth Group asking it to explain $2.4 billion in stock options granted to its top executives; reportedly may withhold its proxy votes for chief executive William McGuire, who will receive $1.6 billion in options, and members of compensation committee (S)
docs.snippet: Calpers, the largest public pension fund, said that the UnitedHealth Group must explain the $2.4 billion in stock options granted to its top executives.

docs.lead_paragraph: When GlaxoSmithKline began talking to Roche three years ago about commercializing the prescription diet drug Xenical, the timing could not have been better for Steven L. Burton. An executive with Glaxo's consumer heath care division, Mr. Burton had been overweight for years, carrying 270 to 275 pounds on his 6-foot-1 frame. Those measurements put him well into the ''obese'' category, a condition shared by 30 percent of American adults. And his doctor had just issued a stern warning to Mr. Burton.

headline.main: Hoping for a Blockbuster; Glaxo Ready to Shift Prescription Diet Pill to Over-the-Counter

docs.snippet: GlaxoSmithKline has tabbed Steven L. Burton to market an over-the-counter version of the diet drug Xenical, which he himself has used to lose weight.

docs.lead_paragraph: For many reasons, people are hesitating to take advantage of the supposed benefit of Medicare's new drug insurance program.

headline.main: Forge Your Way Through the Medicare Drug Maze
headline.print_headline: Forge Your Way Through the Medicare Drug Maze

docs.snippet: For many reasons, people are hesitating to take advantage of the supposed benefit of Medicare's new drug insurance program.

docs.lead_paragraph: After a heated debate between gay rights advocates and critics espousing traditional families, the Nassau County Legislature unexpectedly defeated a proposal on Monday to create a registry for unmarried couples to record domestic partnerships. Supporters said the proposal was similar to local laws adopted across the state, including laws in New York City, Albany, Rochester, and in Westchester and Suffolk Counties.

headline.main: Nassau Plan For a Registry For Partners Is Defeated

docs.abstract: Nassau County Legislature defeats proposal to create registry for unmarried couples to record domestic partnerships; supporters say proposal is similar to local laws adopted across state; critics say proposal's real purpose is to promote gay marriage (M)
